poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: You want to send a farce on tour, You have to pack and package it: Props and pranks, airholes. A deck-hand Faffs with tape and string. The flaps won't meet. The postman Franks a bulge, that farts at him. Take two. The player fasts, subsists on two plain facts Washed down with flasks of fennel tea ad lib. The cast now fits, their flanks are skinny; Still, no fat's no fun - ask Julius C. But this, now, this plays out in council Flats and schemes, in grand apartments. Work it up from Morse, From a one-dimensional fax.
